lines.text: Washington, DC, 1988. President Ronald Reagan today denied once again that he is a candidate for the office of Governor of California.
[catchphrase]
Verrry eenteresting...
Say good night, Dick.
Good night, Dick!
Good night, everybody!
[repeated line]
Hey, next week have we got a show...
I'd like to say something my mother once said.
Would you like to go to a play?
[Gladys hits him]
Would you like to go to a concert?
[Gladys hits him]
Would you like to go to a funeral?
[falls off the park bench]
Now here's the man for whom the news wouldn't be the news without the news, Heeeere's Dicky.
You bet your sweet bippy.
And as a special favor, I'm enclosing our three-color brochure on phone etiquette. You might find it useful.
The preceding was recorded earlier because we were ashamed to do it now.
If Ida Lupino married Don Ho she'd be Ida Ho.
I bet my sweet bippy and lost it.
It's not the hawks and doves that I'm worried about... it's those cuckoos in Washington that want to make pigeons out of all of us.
I don't see why there should be any question about capital punishment. I think everyone in the capital should be punished.
Hey, Goldie, does the high cost of living bother you?
No, I live on the ground-floor apartment.
Different strokes for different folks.
[first lines of the show]
What you're about to see is true.
Only names and faces have been left unchanged... to protect the innocent.
Boris says, "Capitalism doesn't work." But neither does Boris.
It was too bad Frank and Mia broke up, I've always been against mixed marriages.
If they take the violence off TV, the kids won't have anything to watch on Saturday Morning.
I tried to join the Sexual Revolution, but I flunked the physical.

[repeated jingle]
What's the news across the nation/We have got the information/in a way we hope will amuse - you - /We just love to give you our views/La da de da/Ladies and Gents, Laugh-In looks at the news!

[as the News of the Future anchor]
Berlin, 20 years from now, 1989. There was dancing in the streets today as East Germany finally tore down the Berlin Wall. The joy was short-lived, however, as the wall was quickly replaced with a moat full of alligators.
Would you like to play Post Office?
[Gladys hits him]
Would you like to play Spin the Bottle?
[Gladys hits him]
Would you like to play Doctor?
[falls off the park bench]
Would you like to call me Cutie?
[Gladys hits him]
Would you like to call me Sweetie?
[Gladys hits him]
Would you like to call me an ambulance?
[falls off the park bench]
[repeated line]
Here come de Judge, here come de judge!
Sock it to *ME*?
[poem]
The sky is blue. The grass is green. Get off you butts and join the Marines.
[catchphrase]
IS THAT A CHICKEN JOKE?
[repeated line]
Go to your room!
[repeated line]
You're weird, Goldie.
[repeated line]
It's not fair.
[after getting doused with a bucket of water]
[repeated line]
Look THAT up in your Funk and Wagnall's.
One ringy-dingy. Two ringy-dingies.
Oh, good heavens. Someone's copped my tinkle.
How may I, in all humble servitude, be of assistance?
It's so silly getting all uptight with anxieties. I say just sit back, relax, and let your troubles go up in smoke.
The way some of the younger generation carries on, some people wish that they'd develop a birth control pill that was retroactive.
Hey, Goldie, would you ever go on a hunger strike?
No, I couldn't, I'm on a diet.
My I.Q. has never been questioned. Come to think of it, it never been mentioned.
I love Joan Baez, I've even got a set of her autographed fingerprints.
Boris says, "Red China is our friend. And when they get here, they're going to prove it."
We really learned the 3 Rs "Reading, Writing, and Rhythm".
Miss Diller, what can a girl do about bad breath?
Keep your mouth shut.
This show was prerecorded earlier, because it didn't make much sense to prerecorded it later.
Very interesting, not very funny, but very interesting.
How do you get him to follow you?
Honey, just blow in his ear and he'll follow you anywhere.

[as a switchboard operator answering the phone]
NBC, beautiful downtown Burbank.
Did you know that a girl can get into alot of trouble all alone in beautiful downtown Burbank.
I'll always call England the mother country, whether the queen takes the pill or not.
Now THAT tickles my fancy!
